description.narrative: Support to Kampala Pulse Lab Initiative to increase Resilience and well-being of Ugandan vulnerable populations to economic and other shocks with appropriate Government interventions and responses.

participating-org.narrative: THE WILLIAM AND FLORA HEWLETT FOUNDATION

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
1. Number of data innovation projects completed and used to advocate for a global partnership to tap into the data revolution to advance/monitor SDGs.
2. Number of data innovation projects completed and used to advance/monitor SDGs with data science.
3. Existence of advocacy events supporting the development of regulatory frameworks and technical standards to address data sharing and privacy protection challenges, engage key stakeholders on a priority innovation agenda

comment.narrative:
1. No of data innovation projects in place to advocate for a global partnership to tap into the data revolution to advance/monitor Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
2. No of data innovation projects to advance/monitor SDGs with data science.
3. Non-existence of advocacy events to support the development of regulatory frameworks and technical standards to address data sharing and privacy protection challenges, engage key stakeholders on a priority innovation agenda

1. Two (2) South-to-South event organized with seven (7) participants; one (1) capacity building workshop hosted on data privacy and protection with (21) participants; (12) recommendations to the Ugandan Data Privacy and Protection Bill adopted; co-organized two (2) Data Science Africa events with (206) participants collaborating with five (5) universities and eight (8) private sector companies funding the events; conducted three (3) working sessions with Uganda National Bureau of Statistics (UBOS) with five (5) staff from the bureau to define project scope; produced one (1) technology tool and one (1) set of tutorials to launch project on big data for official statistics; organized two (2) dialogues with (32) companies and three (3) government counterparts; published one (1) publication with documented challenges.
2. Completion (100%) of one (1) innovation project with production of three (3) innovative pilot applications to enhance the quality of service delivery in health and education sectors; completion (100%) of one (1) innovation project with development of technology prototypes to conduct mining of people’s voices to inform peacebuilding processes.
3. Two (2) innovative initiative launched to give access to UN Country Team to an open software platform that can be used to increase the effectiveness and efficiency of projects. The platform provides access to QataLog, a data mining software analysis tool the Lab developed, and to additional source code and technical documentation from its repository of projects.

Output 1. Ecosystem enabled by Pulse Lab Kampala for development and adoption of data innovations with big data and real-time analytics to achieve and monitor SDGs localization.
1. 1. 1 No of Private sector companies join the “data philanthropy” movement .
1.1.2 No of Government counterparts adopt real time analytics for SDGs achievement and monitoring
1.1.3 Use of data innovation to support UN Joint Programming and UN Convergence Areas
1.1.4 Participation of the Academia on data innovation for SDG projects
Output 2. Tools built by Pulse Lab Kampala & partners are used to achieve and monitor SDGs localization
1.2.1 Number of tools built by the Lab to use real time data to achieve and monitor SDG localization.
1.2.2 Number of tools built by the Lab to use real time data to achieve and monitor SDG localization.
